intro: Ochoterenaea colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian ochoterenaea, is a flowering plant native to Colombia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many nitrogen-fixing plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in dry or semi-arid environments. Ochoterenaea colombiana is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional uses in local communities.
